title: Scarface remake to hit theaters in 2018 | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share The film's script was recently retooled by the Coen Brothers, whose body of work includes the 1996 cult film 'Fargo' and the Oscar-winning 2007 film 'No Country for Old Men.' Terence Winter, the creator of 'Boardwalk Empire' and a writer for 'The Sopranos,' had previously worked on a draft. Diego Luna, the 'Star Wars: Rogue One' and 'Y Tu Mama Tambien' star, has been floated around as a possible leading man The project does not yet have a director or lead actor. Diego Luna, the 'Star Wars: Rogue One' and 'Y Tu Mama Tambien' star, has been floated around as a possible leading man, USA Today reported. Antoine Fuqua, the director of films such as 'Training Day' and 'The Magnificent Seven,' had been attached to direct but had to leave due to scheduling conflicts, Variety reported. The original 1932 film directed by Howard Hawks was set in Prohibition-era Chicago and was modeled on the life of Al Capone. The 1983 remake from Brian de Palma starred Al Pacino as a Cuban immigrant rising to become a drug lord in 1980s Miami. Will Tony approve?
